values:
Goodbye is like a little death
If only there was a way to carry a little fragment of everything 
that ever touched you
And for each fragment to be big enough to bathe in
when you thirst for the splendid past.

Then goodbye wouldn't feel like violence 
against love as delicate as a spider's thread
that binds hopelessly to dying things.

I wish there was a forever place
to store all sources of wonder
of which you are one.

good intentions all the quotes, you write down in a book and attribute it at the time the photos, you upload into albums the video,s you upload to a cloud and if someone hacks it then i don't even care the ideas go in the book or here, like 'what if individual memories were wiped and all we had was a shared public social media conscious' twitter kil (keep it light) i think happiness/ pride at being loved is melting my brain for better and for worse. destination: *insert image of person turning into goo*

I am reviewing two films. One is a paper-thin cliche-driven not remotely funny battle-of-the-sexes comedy set in Las Vegas. One uses raw footage of dead, broken Jewish bodies in concentration camps to prove that, yes, people actually did this to each other.

Cinema is a broad church.

You can't just be in love and selfish while the world burns.

Maybe you can. I don't know. 

I think the death drive is a smart and clever and parasitic. 

If you can be in love and connected to the world, wow, what a thing.

Be honest with the world
Do this with words and images
Paralysis comes. I think it can be a cured by a loving, trusting, sexual and romantic relationship. Paralysis is loneliness and I rail against people that say loneliness is inevitable.

Tonight is the the night, muthafuckaz. I'm stripping my hair dye out and transforming my room and finishing watching Fill the Void and making a list of stuff to do for work. And maybe I'll need some supportive attention but maybe I won't.

The answer is always to grow so much and so fast that the person that got hurt is left behind.

I want to remember and appreciate that when I tie myself in knots over relationships or technology or whatever that it is a choice to head to that place, not a trauma-induced compulsion.

No one exists in a state of pure freedom 100 percent of the time.

But those of us that worry about things we have chosen to worry about are very lucky.

At some point I will decide what worries I want to colour my life - the trivial or the profound.

And maybe at some point that choice will be taken away from me.

Freedom by itself is such a rush and I want to have access to it forever, through the people I meet and places I go and pleasures I pursue and choices I make.

But independently of social conscious and structured intellectual application it has no morality.

Morality interests me.

Heaven knows why.

Guilt, perhaps.

And also a vague understanding that the freedom I experience now comes from the sweat and generosity of others. 

Or maybe I AM MADE OF MAGIC BEANS.

That's not it.

Obviously.

I am free

Free free free

Free from so many of the forces that bind so many

Currently I am free to run a bath and charge my phone

Love freedom

One of the many admirable traits of Paolo Sorrentino's The Great Beauty is it laughs at no one while poking fun at everyone. Orietta (Isabella Ferrari) is a minor character, a rich beauty who appears at one of Jep's evening soirees and who he takes to bed although as Orietta points out "it didn't seem like you really cared". Such is life when you're used to winning. In a direct and confessional mood, Orietta tells her worldly bed-fellow about her habit of photographing herself constantly every day "to get to know myself". She asks if he'd like to see some of the photos. He accedes but is then gone before she gets back with her glowing MacBook. It is ridiculous to get to know yourself through the shallow medium of the selfie. So why have I got this affliction as badly as Orietta? Getting close to something good and rich and meaningful yet still encumbered with habits of the uninspired. Doucement... Here's the trailer for The Great Beauty. Can't recommend it enough. It = both trailer and film.

This is turning into something of a lost weekend.
Loving it.
But hate having work hanging over me.
Find a way to turn it into play...
Creativity is intelligence having fun.

I am addicted to the surface of things... it goes for myself, for others and for objects.

Depth perception as a daily feature is in short supply. Being a thinking being, insights and observations do come and I am prone to slipping down into myself but I do not like depths. I like their weighty surface transmissions.

What is hidden is not real until it has an outlet.

I don't want to be overdramatic but this week has moved me forward more than any week previously. Sex, money, work, wisdom. Everything, everywhere.

I am here, I am real, I can have it all if I let myself be smart.

I'm going to take more codeine. The excitement is too, too much.

I can't find my nail scissors and my toe might be broken and I posted a too self-deprecating comment on a picture of myself on Facebook.

Fair enough... for an 18-year-old. I'm 28.

This is what happens when you feed years into the brain chipper that is mental disorder. My relative recovery loses lustre in contrast with people who instinctively went straight and now, while younger than me, are better than me.

I can't even lavishly compliment them simultaneously educating them about my life... yet.

It wouldn't cross their mind that I lived how I did. Debilitating bulimia is off the map for the well-adjusted.

But what's real for everyone is sexual attraction and something fascinating if minute happened tonight.

Success is the best revenge.
Rightness is the best cure for wrongness.

That's all I got.

When I moved into this room 6 months ago it was empty and clean, like my insides, which had been exhaustively purged via Rohne.

That's not a new brand of laxative, but the hunky, hulky South African who I would have loved had he not fallen back in with his ex. The extraordinary feeling of lacking that bursted and ballooned within subsequent to that revelation carried with it the consolation prize of a need to act on and improve my environment.

This is not an urge that captivates me today. Hence my room is a tip and I barely care. I try to care. it just doesn't matter like it did when I was heartbroken.

I used to see ambition as a negative force to be avoided. Now it seems fine as long as it's balanced. So if I want to do better professionally I should try equally hard in my personal life.

When you think about it there is nothing to fear. People often say the more you have the more you can lose but I'm not scared of chaos or nothingness. That is where I come from and where I'll go back to. Same with all of you.

In the meantime, it's a good idea to make maximum sense, a feeling that comes from organisation built on organisation built on heart.

Demons are the feelings and behaviours that lead to nonsense, at least to me now armed with my new ambitions.

Imagine the heights of sophistication we could enter if it wasn't for hunger. I feel momentum cycling then it's time to eat and CRASH BANG WHALLOP down we go

there was a guy who invented his own formula which contained all the nutrients we need. wonder how he's doing.

without hunger, greed and lumpen bodily consequences it would be freedom all the way. sex would not be a journey through physical shame, it would be... I don't know and this is why i won't let him go.

Getting lost is the easiest thing in the world.
Losing yourself.
Hair dye, impulsive behaviour, calculated behaviour, make-up, strange confidence, strange introversion, good luck, bad luck, encouragement, silence, inviting people closer, pushing them away, gorging, drinking, writing, interviewing, saying too much, saying too little, being kind, being selfish, spending money, saving money, losing yourself in fiction, diving deeply into others around you, being a child, being a grown up, helping, not helping, glowering, smiling, caring, not caring, travelling, staying still, embracing feminine wiles, remaining stoically neutral, bathing, showering, thinking, reading, staring blankly for hours, refreshing the same old internet pages, saying things you shouldn't but why shouldn't you? You can do anything. There are no rules or boundaries, you're just a thing rolling around unchaperoned.

Apparently adopting a loving approach to yourself helps (helps what?) Let's say it helps the vessel (me) get things done (what am I trying achieve?) Creative things, loving things, creative loving things. I want someone to love but that's not really just up to me. Is there a way to live without it hurting so much?

Maybe I should go back into therapy. Why did I have to be born in this capital city
Maybe I should make a list of exhibits and museums and go to see one a week
Maybe I should cut out the toxic things I mentioned in my previous post
Maybe I should stop being scared of coming across as uncool
Maybe I should make a list of people that matter and not give a fuck about the rest
Maybe I should buy good ingredients and tidy my room and save my money and buy things I need and get rid of what I don't 
Maybe I should organise my room so there is a work surface
Maybe I should top being scared of coming across as unattractive

from Songs from Below

It's easy to talk, and writing words on the page
doesn't involve much risk as a general rule:
you might as well be knitting late at night
in a warm room, in a soft, treacherous light.
The words are all written in the same ink,
'flower' and 'fear' are nearly the same for example,
and I could scrawl 'blood' the length of the page
without splashing the paper or hurting
myself at all.

After a while it gets you down, this game,
you no longer know what it was you set out to achieve
instead of exposing yourself to life
and doing something useful with your hands.

That's when you can't escape,
when pain is a figure tearing the fog
that shrouds you, striking away
the obstacles one by one, covering
the swiftly decreasing distance, now
so close you can make out nothing
but his mug wider than the sky.

To speak is to lie, or worse: a craven
insult to grief or a waste
of the little time and energy at our disposal.

*

Might there be things which lend themselves
more readily to words, and live with them
- those glad moments gladly found in poems,
light that releases words
as if erasing them; while other things
resist them, change them, destroy them even - 

as if language resisted death,
or rather, as if death consumed
even the words?

PHILIPPE JACCOTTET
translated from the French by Derek Mahon

Things are not shit.

Also, yay, socialism in France.

Because love grows where my Rosemary goes

And nobody knooooows like me

:D

Dear Journal,

Please neatly arrange yourself under certain uniform tags with transparent post names and recurring themes of entry. The main reason I keep you is because my memory is non-existent and it seems like it might be useful, at some stage, to be able to recall my life. But in your current form, you're a wild jungle, an unnavigable mass of words on a kaleidoscope of different subjects. How will I use you in years to come if you persist in your unruly behaviour?

Oh confound you, journal and confound that I began deleting you from the beginning once upon a time. Journal, I don't know why I keep you. You are a secret from everyone in my life. You are an outlet for thoughts that I'm not convinced need to be outed. Everyone has thoughts that go round and round and ultimately they decide which ones are important. I haven't decided which ones are important and you are a holding pen for my indecision. You are where I keep excess thoughts but maybe really, like the man who keeps the daily newspapers, I should just kick the storage habit and make a trip to the dump.

Ho hum and fiddledy dee.

I bought the 20th anniversary copy of the Big Issue (English magazine sold by and profited from by the homeless) and am pulsating with rage. On page 8 with his face gleaming like a scrubbed scrotum is a photo of David Cameron. He's shaking hands with a Big Issue vendor on the steps of 10 Downing Street and there's a sound bite saying: "I've always been a supporter of this fantastic institution..."

REALLY?  WHY DON'T YOU STOP IMPLEMENTING POLICIES THAT MAKE MORE PEOPLE HOMELESS YOU SHAMELESS SNAKE OF A MAN?

I was so incensed that I scrawled the c-word on his forehead. I was sitting on the tube at the time and the lady beside me noticed and struck up a conversation with me about wtf the destroyer of the welfare state is doing proclaiming his welfare credentials on the pages of the Big Issue. We both ranted until she got off the tube.

(She was kind of hot.)

ANYWAY, not much stirs me to acts of journalism these days but, if it's the last thing I do, I'm going to set up an interview with John Bird and ask him  - after we have spent a respectful amount of time discussing the general goodness of the BI - if he sees the weirdness of featuring a man whose raison d'etre is "shit on the poor" in a magazine which gives the very poor a ray of light.

"The weight of this sad time we must obey.
Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say.
The oldest hath borne most. We that are young
Shall never see so much, nor live so long."

-King Lear, William Shakespeare

My god, it was ugly, so ugly that even looking upon it pained the eyes. It was so ugly that Siegfried assumed anyone who glimpsed it would flinch in identikit revulsion. It therefore came as a shock to him, a shock so great that he walked directly into a bollard, that others spoke of it with laughter and even when they talked of its ugliness it was in a casual way, to them the ugliness could be thrown away and forgot about.

But then, Siegfried reasoned after putting the bollard incident behind him, there were probably things he gazed at occasionally and never thought of that others wrestled with long into the night.

***************

People talk so often about the beauty of life and the inspirations that spread like dominoes falling but what about the crimes that make victims of, first, the people at the wrong end of them then, second, the sponge people who soak up the details and can never cut those details out.

There are be parts of the brain where quicksand lies, quick to suck the inspiration out and sand the noble aspiration down. What good is wisdom when there is quicksand? What use is empathy?

Henry drinks deeply from the wisdom of books and clever friends. The wisdom tastes just right and as it alights on his tongue he senses how each drop could fuel a movement and how each movement applied together with the right intention could start a revolution. Visionary hope comes alive powered by the brilliance and strangeness of a thousand fireflies but then GULP he swallows it down.

Where did it go?

"I have been watching my life. It's right there. I keep scratching at it, trying to get into it. I can't."
Mad Men

Dear Diary,

As of 24 hours ago I have been driving myself insane.

I don't believe in love at first sight. I particularly don't believe in love at first sight when I have deadlines waiting the following day. I tried to calm myself earlier with some lovely codeine but it was much stronger than usual and I have just risen from four hours of lying paralytically still in bed. This has not helped the deadline fear or the romantic insanity.

You have to understand the context. I do not trust men. This trust has been leaking away quietly and now I am forced to confront a thoroughly empty bucket. The empty bucket I understand. I like men and flirt with them and amuse myself with interactions that are neither here nor there. This is convenient as I have no time or mental space for a romantic escapade right now. I have two deadlines tomorrow, a media law exam in a week then after that a month to complete my final masters project.

 

This is not the time to start anything.

But I must be a fool because I am thinking that a 24-year-old Swedish-Irishman who speaks six languages can offer more than this postgraduate course which cost more effort than anything before and is nearly over.

I should do the right thing and describe how we met.

Again the context may have something to do with my current palpitations. I watched two people who were dopey with love get married in a church in York. It wasn't like I was watching the bride thinking "when will it be meeee?" but, discounting the cloying levels of Jesus in the ceremony, I guess it was a beautiful day. However I caught the train back to London before desert so I could attend Phil, the editor of the music paper's birthday.

This in itself had me in a state of anxious pride. Why the hell would I be invited? Also, what mind-bogglingly stupid thing would I say to poison my future relationship with him and the paper? I had to go. If someone you madly respect who can also help your career invites you to something, you go, even if it means missing chocolate parfait.

I got the train to Kings X then hopped on a bus to Old St. Sitting on the bus I could feel the boy beside me staring. Eventually, he stuck out a hand so I turned to look at him.

"Can I touch your hair?"

His eyes were wide and blonde hair poked out from under a beanie. There were massive retro-style headphones slung around his neck. I drank him in while saying "uhhhh". Despite his looks, it would have been my instinct to not engage with a boy who asks to touch my hair on a bus. However, I was in a wide-open mind state from a week of travelling in Germany by myself.

I let him touch my hair then he said he had only been in London for two weeks and had been travelling for two years round various places in Europe + the North Pole but he hadn't reached N90 so he was going back to do that. He was going to Brick Lane now to meet a friend who was heading off to Thailand the next day. I told him I was going to Dalston for the birthday which was open invitation. He showed enthusiasm so I wrote the address into his phone. He guessed my age which people usually get wrong. I was impressed. Then it was my stop. We parted on a note of maybe-see-you-later.

I wasn't convinced he would come. Most Londoners would show enthusiasm and then not. But most Londoners wouldn't have approached me like he did.

I got to the address of the party and waited down a dubious alley for Siobhan. Was too crippled with self-consciousness to go in by myself. She took fifteen minutes then we went in. It was like a sauna. Sweat was dripping down the inside lining of my demure cream dress within minutes. A nice man at the bar bought us drinks then I spotted Luke who works for the music website. Went over and chatted to him. Then Phil came. He seemed genuinely pleased I had come and tore open my card like he was an eleven-year-old boy who knew there was an xbox inside. He gave me a lovely hug then...

...fuck me, it's the bus boy with his friend. I was so happy. It was a slightly different vibe from earlier. There had been no touching earlier. This time he hugged me. Everything about him was pumped full of vitality. I could see how fit he was under his shirt and the combination of this with the jungle heat made me feel weak at the knees.

Everything else was going well from the free drink to the good reception from both Phil and Luke - men I admire professionally and personally to a stupid extent. Bus boy's hand would occasionally graze me accidentally-on-purpose and my every nerve electrified. I like to think I played it pretty cool conversationally.

Went downstairs to watch a heavy guitar band. Siobhan hated it and seeing as she had been such a good sport about keeping me company I asked if she wanted to head to a warehouse party she had mentioned earlier. Hers was an unequivocally affirmative response. I told the boys and asked if they wanted to come too. Yes.

Said goodbye to Phil and Luke. Outside the club I decided I should go home to give myself a fighting chance of working the next day. Bus boy tried to persuade me to come with them but my logic was powerful and he conceded. Something about him was so...assured. He made it so clear he liked me. He even said "I really like you". It felt so good, being in his headlights. I can still feel the small kiss and his powerful arms.

See, this was a perfectly-contained romantic episode. I am happy with this. I almost wish we hadn't exchanged numbers because it can only go downhill and undermine the gentle enjoyment of our brief time together. I have already imagined the best-case scenario and even that will surely fuck up my masters.

Oh god.

""Violent winds do not blow all morning. Sudden rain cannot pour all day. What causes these things? Heaven & Earth.
If Heaven & Earth do not blow and pour for long, How much less should humans?" the ancient Tao Te Ching, by Lao Tzu.
I don't think I know many "bad" people in the pure sense but that people are "intrinsically good" matters less than that they are "warm"
I don't think I am ready for anything more developed. I would give something a good go if it was clearly worth it but it's not a bad idea to learn to get on by myself
Good things: hold-ups, youth, proven survival ability, wearing your heart on your sleeve but wearing a jumper over it so people won't find it unless they're looking

Oh, the constant agonies of...generally everything. I have to do so much nice stuff to keep the balance even. 

Today, I had oysters for the first time. Public Enemy may say 'don't believe the hype' but actually go ahead and believe it. Oysters are sensual explosions whose aftertatse and effects just keep bouncing around your mouth. Me and Abby bought two Colchesters for £2.80 at a stall on Borough market. A little later we came back and bought  two more. The next thing we know we're in Wright Brothers having a lunch of oysters and champagne. The decadence. I'm going back for the Fruits de Mer platter. 

Reading Graham Greene and in agonies over my stupidity and my lover's reserve. At my request, he let me have it with both barrels on Wednesday night and since then I have been in fear of desertion and in awe of the breadth of my attachment to him. When I was single and yearning for a boyfriend, I imagined how we would be joined together in a montage of wholesome fun. I never thought about the arguments, the silences, the insecurity, the crticisms. If someone had told me that there would be so much of this I would have said 'dude, you walk away at that point' but love feels more important than an easy life. Love feels like a medicine that you'd have to be insane to reject even though it sometimes tastes like battery acid.

If you are chasing your own star then you probably aren't paying strictest attention to the star of a friend or lover or parent or brother. This is why it's importance to:

a) "tread softly because you tread on my dreams" and

b)  not be a twat

I think I've just unearthed my key values.

Being there for certain people

Keeping perspective - containing  instinctive views until someone else has spoken

Noticing what needs to be done to improve a situation

Improving the situation

Staying calm and in possession of your humour

Trying EXCEPTIONALLY hard at what you identify as important (see Kipling's heart and nerve and sinew)

Adhering to your individual values

Having your shit together (for a per cent of the time)

Capability

1. This lightness can't continue. There will be something to trip me up tomorrow. But that is only right.

2.  I  have two shadows to emerge from. I want to do them proud. I want to make good.

3. I know I'm coming out of my shock because
a) I can think straight and
b) I'm obsessing about myself again.
Trusty narcissism.

4. Little by little I am going to give up everything that doesn't help me make good.

5. I doubt this journal makes good.

6. What is good?

7. Chilling out and listening is good.

x

It's so funny when - after a history of being self-destructive - you discover that you're actually more responsible than a lot of people you know. The way it works is that whoever CAN shoulder the burden ends up doing so.  The harder, faster, better, stronger you get, the more you get run through your paces. Freedom exists as freedom to rise or shy from the challenges and responsibilities that dangle ahead. The freedom to do anything meaningful like choose your destiny takes a LOT of planning and intelligence and Lady Luck,  of course, must be on your side.

Bring it on.

x

I have crossed an ocean
I have lost my tongue
From the root of the old one
a new one has sprung

More lessons

*don't eat on the underground unless, and perhaps even when, rabid with hunger - the stifling conditions make me want to choke it back up
*build people up always, in print and in life - perhaps with the exception of when dealing with official bodies on the phone 
*don't give money to homeless people until i have cleared my debts with loved ones (got fleeced out of a fiver by a ridiculously charming man at london bridge. muggins)
*i need more than five hours sleep and am lying to myself when i plan to get up after 0.3 seconds and perform 12.5million tasks
*the foal is nice! - i felt mortified when - in the wake of asking him to email me his set list - i acted retarded and he acted moody but he DID email me, and in a pleasant fashion to boot
*like many things, friendliness is about intelligence
*don't mix two stressors - e.g. liam and mother
* when people say negative things about people  that i like, instead of clamming up and being neutral, attempt to engulf them with positivism. this is the way to world peace.
*the goal is wit and humour. the goal is ALWAYS wit and humour
* i feel better when i restrain the urge to tell lots of personal stories and instead LISTEN to the personal stories being told
* liam has a bossy streak. when it rears its voluble head do not argue. this will only inflame the bossing
*my next boyfriend will be sociable, financially secure and calm. i'm not falling in love with any more losers.
*i'm starting to get why people value 'niceness'. irresponsible people are rapidly losing their charm. once you start to believe in social good, rogues taken on the appearance of spoilsports. OH FUCK, i am heading to the establishment, i have a convert's zeal for it
*erotic review is a haven.
*do not facebook stalk my friends (even if i do think they are totally beautiful). it makes me feel awkward when i see them which is not remotely helpful.
